intro: Ononis natrix subsp. microphylla, commonly known as small-leaved sand-rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has small, lanceolate leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. This subspecies is distinguished by its smaller leaves compared to other subspecies of Ononis natrix.
